intro: Koeleria thonii, commonly known as the Sierra grass, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its fine, tufted foliage and small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in alpine and subalpine environments. It produces delicate blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Koeleria thonii is adapted to cold climates and is often found in mountainous regions of California, Nevada, and Utah.
